results.title: Account Associate, Education
results.description:
Status: Full-time

Type: Exempt

Reports to: Senior Director of Education

ABOUT TECHCHANGE

Want to be part of a growing company that is using technology, pedagogy, and design to bring about positive social change? Founded in 2010, we are a social enterprise that works with leading nonprofits and government agencies worldwide to push the boundaries of what's possible in virtual learning and online events. From delivering an online series of courses on COVID response for frontline health workers to powering the world's largest human rights and tech conference (RightsCon), TechChange contributes to some of the most innovative and important conversations of our era.

TechChange provides human-powered services like facilitation, production, support, and design and a user-centric platform to support over 500K users across some 800 courses, workshops, and events. 

ROLE OVERVIEW

The Account Associate is an entry-level role for candidates interested in developing their client-facing, curriculum development, and virtual learning/collaboration tool belt. They work collaboratively and proactively with education team members to support the development and launch of beautiful and engaging learning experiences on topics that matter in a variety of formats such as courses, workshops, and learning events. In this role, you will support the creation of powerful learning experiences to achieve partner success in alignment with TechChange pedagogical best practices.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

On a typical day, Account Associates may work individually, or with a project team. A successful candidate will undertake the following duties and more as instructed by the Account Manager: 

  • Assist in the planning and implementation of projects
  • Help to coordinate and manage project tasks and deliverables, as assigned
  • Configure interactive learning experiences in native TechChange platform, informed by project design and client's needs
  • Support live learning events (moderating breakout discussions, supporting learnings of participants/clients) 
  • Analyze data as required
  • Recommend tools, activities, and design elements to improve students' overall experience
  • Liaise and coordinate deliverables with creative team and resources
  • Liaise with project stakeholders concerning project details and deliverables, as assigned
  • Act as a reliable team contributor by collaborating with colleagues on solution development and serving as a resource to Education team colleagues
  • Provide feedback into systems and processes that will improve role effectiveness contributing to inter-and-cross-team initiatives as needed
  • Develop and maintain knowledge and understanding of TechChange business and offerings
  • Perform other duties assigned by the Account Manager in an orderly and efficient manner
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
  • 1-3 years of workforce experience 
  • Highly organized and detail-oriented
  • Familiarity with teaching, education, and/or instructional design preferred
  • Ability to upskill quickly in new and evolving technical and SaaS software
  • Excellent interpersonal skills for collaborating effectively with others 
  • A self-starter who can multitask, work well under pressure, and work efficiently to meet strict deadlines while maintaining quality 
  • Ability to maintain understanding of project purpose and objectives
  • Poses an analytical and critical mindset for making the best decisions for successfully executing duties 
  • Competent public speaker and written/verbal communicator 
  • Highly coachable: takes feedback and appropriately applies at next available opportunity (Growth Mindset) 
  • Technical skills not required, a plus:
    • Virtual facilitation tools: Miro, Slido or Mentimeter, Zoom (or similar video conferencing tools) 
    • Project Management tools: Monday.com etc. 
  • Fluency in English required. Fluency in additional languages is highly valued
REMOTE/TIME ZONE CONSIDERATIONS

Remote (distributed, work-from-home structure); flexible east coast hours while serving global clients.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The position will require extensive time sitting or standing and viewing computer screens from a home setup. The following capabilities may be required to perform this position's essential functions. Reasonable accommodations can be made available to address the following requirements.

  • May occasionally lift, carry, stoop, bend, etc. (no more than 20 pounds).
  • Ability to travel in the US and internationally (less than 10% time, when appropriate)
COMPENSATION

Salary range: $55,000 - $65,000 annually

BENEFITS
  • 3 weeks of paid time off 
  • 5-day winter shutdown
  • 10 company holidays
  • Parental leave 
  • Paid Sabbatical Leave
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Plans
  • 401k, with company matching (eligible after 6 months)
  • Discretionary Profit Sharing Program
  • Professional development funding
  • Remote work 
APPLICATION DEADLINE 

Open until filled. 

EOE STATEMENT

TechChange is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. We know that our differences make us better. TechChange does not discriminate based on race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

results.title: Sales Development Representative
results.description:
About Novata

Novata is a public benefit corporation created and funded by a unique consortium of foundations and private sector companies including the Ford Foundation, the Omidyar Network, S&P Global, and Hamilton Lane. We are a for-profit, mission-driven company with a goal of empowering the private markets to build a more inclusive and sustainable form of capitalism. By bringing together the brightest minds in financial data, private equity, social justice and inclusive capitalism, we aim to build the best technology and tools for the private markets to better collect, analyze, benchmark, and report ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance) data. We have an experienced and diverse team who are as ambitious about growing a successful company as we are about making an impact. We hope you’ll join us.

About the role

We’re looking for a results-driven sales development representative to actively seek new business opportunities, engage and build relationships with potential customers. You will provide complete and appropriate solutions for every potential customer to boost top-line revenue growth, customer acquisition levels, and profitability.

Requirements

Key Responsibilities

  • Qualify leads from marketing campaigns as sales opportunities
  • Contact potential prospects through cold calls and emails
  • Present our company to potential prospects
  • Identify prospect's needs and suggest appropriate products/services
  • Build long-term trusting relationships with prospects
  • Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market
  • Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) customers and Account Executives
  • Report to the Sales Manager on sales results

 

About you

 

The ideal candidate will have the following professional experience:

  • Proven work experience as a Sales Development Representative, Sales Account Executive, or similar role
  • SaaS/Tech based experience a plus
  • Comfortable in start-up/scale-up environment
  • Hands-on experience with multiple sales prospecting techniques like cold calling, cold emailing, and social outreach.
  • Track record of achieving sales quotas
  • Experience working with Hubspot

 

Work Style

  • Fair understanding of sales performance metrics
  • Excellent communication and negotiation skills
  • Ability to deliver engaging presentations
  • Quick on your feet
  • Positive, won’t quit attitude
  • Prospecting
  • Listening
  • Product Knowledge

Benefits

We want our employees to have the best opportunities at work and in life. We know that requires us to provide more than just a great place to work. We are committed to providing industry-leading benefits and flexibility that allow you to achieve all your life goals. Here are the important highlights:

  • Competitive salary reviewed annually to account for market shifts
  • Equity in the company (stock options)
  • Comprehensive health benefits packages (private medical, pension scheme)
  • Robust leave policies (PTO, parental leave, VTO)
  • Flexible work environment with full support for remote work and access to co-working space in London
  • Opportunities for personal and professional development
  • An experienced, mature, and extremely enthusiastic team that thrives on collaboration

 

Why Join Us?

Novata is a mission-first company built to enable the private markets to drive more impact. We are at the unique intersection of ESG, the private markets, and mission-driven impact. We are well-funded, have a top-tier executive leadership team, and have experienced a successful commercial launch in the first half of 2022. We have a highly aggressive growth plan to establish ourselves as the industry leader of ESG with immediate plans for product and international expansion.

Members of our leadership team have been globally recognized for their success as leaders of large public companies, founders of successful startups, leaders of established ESG organizations, and builders of robust tech platforms. We are passionate, highly motivated, and experienced individuals who embrace our diverse backgrounds. Together, we will become the platform of choice and a catalyst for a change in the way business is done.

Novata is an Equal Opportunity Employer and it is our policy that we will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other protected category with respect to recruitment, hiring, training, promotion and other terms and conditions of employment.

results.title: Account Manager
results.description:
Account Manager

At Ireckonu, the Account Manager is an empowered position accountable for all elements of the client relationship. This role focuses on building strong partnerships with key account decision makers, resulting in positive outcomes and a high customer retention rate. You will also ensure that projects are delivered to scope, on-time and on-budget.

Account Managers must think both strategically and operationally, working to develop a deep understanding of the customer and their future needs while balancing the delivery of sold work. The Account Manager is responsible for planning, overseeing, and leading projects from ideation through to completion. You will leverage your in-depth knowledge of the customer to (jointly) formulate a growth-focused vision for your accounts, including an Account Plan.

The Account Manager role is key at Ireckonu and requires interaction with a range of internal and external stakeholders, most often managing several moving project parts simultaneously.

Account Responsibilities

  • Ability to understand the customer’s business goals and needs, and to translate them into product recommendations and strategic Account Plans.
  • Identify customer specific pain points or competitive disadvantages and capture new sales opportunities.
  • Implement & lead a consultative selling approach to strategically position Ireckonu’s value proposition.
  • Accurately and effectively document Account-related details & information, including ongoing updates to the CRM.
  • Contribute to internal product growth and roadmap discussions, using your in-depth customer knowledge to create added value for both the company and your accounts.
  • Communicate with the customer’s main points of contact to keep the project aligned with their goals – organize Quarterly Business Reviews.

Project Responsibilities

  • Assist in the definition, documentation and communication of project scope and goals.
  • Responsible for planning and overseeing projects to ensure that your customer’s projects are delivered to scope, in a timely fashion and within budget.
  • Create long and short-term plans, including setting targets for milestones, adhering to deadlines, and allocating resources.

  • Leverage an understanding of internal resources and capabilities to effectively delegate tasks to those best positioned to complete them.
  • Identify and manage risks, issues and dependencies from start to finish, and adjust schedules and targets on the project as needed.
  • Make effective and informed decisions when confronted with multiple options for how to progress with the project.
  • Ensure project teams remain cohesive and in synergy by facilitating consistent alignment and mitigating roadblocks before they become an issue.
  • Perform quality control tests throughout development to ensure client deliverables are to the highest standard and meet customer’s expectations.

Requirements

Hard skills:

  • Knowledge of various project management methodologies (e.g., agile/scrum)
  • Technical comprehension of APIs is an asset
  • Cost and risk management skills
  • Project planning & execution (incl. Jira usage & project plan creation)
  • Effective time management of yourself and others
  • Ability to create both internal and external alignment

Soft skills:

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and prioritisation skills
  • Ability to communicate well with people on different levels and explain complicated technical concepts to technical and non-technical people
  • Ability to delegate effectively and make important decisions under pressure
  • Problem-solving skills
  • Friendly and approachable
  • Pro-active, sense of responsibility and demonstrated ability to work independently
  • Strong work ethic and positive team attitude
  • Fluency in English is required. Additional European languages are beneficial

Benefits

What Ireckonu Offers:

When you join Ireckonu, you will be working in a forward thinking, flat organization with a family-oriented support system. We organize and participate in sports events (cycling, running and soccer/futbal) and provide a daily healthy, “family” style lunch in our canteen. Our culture is one of an informal working atmosphere: come as you are, work hard, and support others. Beyond this we also offer:

  • Prime location – Our headquarters is in the historic Olympic Stadium in Amsterdam
  • Hybrid remote working
  • We can assist you in the VISA process if necessary

results.title: Senior Account Manager
results.description:
Senior Account Manager (Covering Welsh Region)

Who are you?

We are looking for an ambitious Account Manager to drive account growth and work closely with our client wing to deliver a best-in-class service each and every time!

Key responsibilities

  • Actively manage sales cycle for existing accounts; analyse and present data to your clients on a quarterly basis and support your clients with needs-based business cases.
  • Achieve and maintain high levels of satisfaction among senior stakeholder’s client side, achieving target scores from identified stakeholders.
  • Full contract management including renewals, change notices, risk mitigation and escalation, as well as involvement within bids and tenders
  • Provide internal forecasting reports on key customer commercial metrics
  • Understand what really matters to your stakeholders and the client, present benefits and value delivered to the Trust internally at Board and review meetings and via external comms
  • Work closely with sales and marketing team to generate leads into other Trusts, ICS, STP, and align strongly with our infamous transformation team to ensure we can deliver!

 

OK, that’s me, but who are DrDoctor?

DrDoctor is a HealthTech company on an exciting growth trajectory. Our technology focuses on engaging patients across their healthcare journey while saving hospitals time, effort, and money.

Our Mission is that healthcare needs a reset. More people need care every day and health services struggle. Current patient engagement is a mess of disparate systems that hinder, rather than help care delivery.

Our Vision is a remote-first healthcare system, which can meet demand without sacrificing care quality. We want patients to be engaged in their care, shifting to a digital first model.

We do this at scale:

  • 17 million+ patients use DrDoctor
  • We manage over 70 million appointments
  • We work with over 44 NHS Trusts and Health Boards (and still growing!)

We :green_heart: the NHS and want to help it work better. We radically transform the delivery of health services to make healthcare work for everyone – for patients, doctors, administrative teams and taxpayers.

OK, I’m interested. What experience do I need to have?

  • Demonstrable experience working with the NHS, ideally in a digital capacity.
  • Experience working as an Account Manager/Success Manager, focusing on account optimisation and upsell, with a track record in change management, project delivery or meeting sales targets
  • You know how to adapt your style to varying levels of people within the NHS
  • Have the ability to simplify a complex set of problems and structure the right solution for our clients - this may include project planning, technical understanding, benefits analysis etc.
  • You excel in a high growth, fast-paced, agile environment, and love getting the work done right
  • You are passionate about our mission 

We know from research and experience that candidates may not apply if they don’t think they meet 100% of our requirements. If you don’t tick all the boxes but feel you would be a good fit, we would still love to hear from you. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture!

Just to let you know too, we will need you to have the Right To Work in the UK, and as we work closely with the NHS, if we get to the stage where we make you an offer to join us, we will also need to undertake a DBS check.

We are perfect for each other, what are the next steps?

We are currently recruiting heavily and have a lot of CVs to go through. However, we don’t wait for roles to close before going through your CV. We will be in touch in a few days to let you know if we think we might be a match, and if we are not. Unfortunately, because we get so many CV’s we are not able to send an individual reply if it’s not a match. However, if you want more details as to why, just drop us a note and we will arrange to get some feedback over to you.

If it’s a match, then we will arrange a time to talk to you on a quick 30 minute call. It’s just an informal chat so you can relax! We will tell you more about the role, the team and why you should want to join us.

If we continue, then we will invite you in to meet the team and founders. Some our roles will also be subject to completing an assessment.

We get there are a lot of great roles out there, so we will make sure to get through the rounds as quickly as possible. All we ask is you keep us up to date with your plans.

I can’t wait to get started, what are the perks?

An awesome team? Ok, you want more?

  • Remote by default approach - Everyone at DrDoctor will work remotely most of the time with regular opportunities to socialise and engage at office spaces available in London and Manchester.
  • Flexible working (we understand we all have family and personal commitments; you can work where you are at your best and at times when you are most productive)
  • Part time working considered - let us know what you need and we’ll do our best to find the right balance for both parties
  • 25 days holiday plus Bank Holidays (with our own extra DrDoctor Bank Holidays thrown in for good measure!)
  • 4 duvet days per year for those days that you just don’t fancy working
  • Personal development time every other Friday, or for a whole day per month, differing based on which team you’re in
  • Mental health support through our partner OpenUp and our own in-house Mental Health First Aiders
  • Drinks/other fun things sent to you in the post
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • A new office space in Southwark including a Multipurpose quiet room which can be used for activities such as Prayer, Meditation, or caring for your baby
  • Enhanced parental leave (up to 16 weeks fully paid parental leave for anyone who brings a child into their home – whether this is via birth, adoption or surrogacy)
  • Salary competitive and dependant on experience, we benchmark our salaries to accurately reflect the market at least once a year, and we benchmark all of our roles (regardless of where in the UK you live) based on London salaries.
  • A focus on your career progression based on our progression framework, regular 6 months' pay reviews and mentoring opportunities
  • EMI share options scheme!

As DrDoctor has grown, we are seeing more of our people wanting to socialise in different ways.

Whilst we know that some of us love to go to the pub, we want to make sure we are including a wide variety of activities and events for our teams to enjoy each other's company, we aim to continue creating an open space for anyone and everyone to suggest how they’d like to spend time with their teams.

We love a Summer and Christmas party and regular company/team socials and away days. So far in 2022, we have enjoyed picnics at a nearby farm, a water colouring session, board games evening and Crystal Maze! We have also held various events for celebrations such as Eid ul-Fitr, Holi Festival, International Women’s Day and our 10 year anniversary!

Salary banding for this role is: £55,000 - £70,000 + Commission

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Do you innovate with integrity? Believe a team is stronger together? Are you passionate about sustainability? If these are some of the attributes that describe you, then read on. We are looking for courageous, collaborative, and curious problem solvers who are interested in joining our team to help us develop solutions to complex challenges.

Digimarc is a global leader in product digitization, delivering business value across industries through unique identities and cloud-based solutions. A trusted partner in deterring counterfeiting of global currency for more than 20 years, Digimarc uncovers a product's journey to provide intelligence and promote a prosperous, safer, and more sustainable world. With Digimarc, you can finally see everything. And when you see everything, you can achieve anything. For more information, visit us at digimarc.com.

 

THE CHALLENGE…

Join our mission to digitize everything! We're seeking an ambitious account executive with a hunter mentality to focus on finding new business prospects and help them envision and digitized future where anything is possible. Bring your creative side to consult with key decision makers, identify their business goals, and develop engaging proposals for our watermarking technology which demonstrate the value of customer insights and experiences with their brand. In this role, you’ll have the flexibility of working remotely within our RevTeam and be responsible for fully understanding a client’s needs and determining whether we can meet those needs. This is a newly created role with the goal of increasing our sales velocity reporting to our VP, of Product Sales.

 

WHAT YOU WILL DO…

As a direct sales Account Executive, you will focus on new account development and/or expanding existing accounts within an established geographic territory or product line selling products or services directly to the end user. Additionally, you’ll work with clients to cultivate future projects and qualify for new opportunities.

Requirements

  • 3+ years of SaaS sales experience as a quota-carrying individual contributor
  • Strong outbound prospecting skills; confident in cold calling, and use of SalesLoft a plus
  • Track record of attaining quota
  • Ability to accurately forecast deals within a quarter, ideally by month
  • Consultative sales approach to uncover business objectives and position solutions
  • Resourceful; ability to work independently and within cross-functional teams
  • Meticulous use of Salesforce CRM to track activities, opportunities, etc.
  • Adaptable, and comfortable with change

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Restricted stock units
  • Comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, vision, & retirement savings plan
  • Flexible time off / holidays
  • Mentorship opportunities

 

A reasonable estimate of the current range is 80k-$95K, plus commission/bonus. This compensation range considers the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill set, experience, training, licensure, certifications, geography and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled.

 

Digimarc is seeking diverse applicants. We are an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected factor. We want the best people who share our values.


This job posting is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

 

Principals only. No recruiters please.

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
TuxCare is a Division of CloudLinux Inc., the maker of the #1 OS in security and stability for hosting providers. TuxCare provides a set of services to automate, simplify and enhance Linux security and operations for the Enterprise. It reduces the management tasks and patch delay risks with live patching, completely bypassing the need for complex service migration orchestration even when you have high availability in place.

The TuxCare Account Executive role is the front-line of revenue generation for the business. In this role you will be responsible for daily prospect engagement by finding leads, managing the sales cycle, negotiation, and closing deals. Supported by a team of Linux experts in presales, engineering and marketing, the Account Executive is the top driver of corporate growth.

For more details go to tuxcare.com.

As our Account Executive you will be responsible for:

  • Engage with new inbound leads daily
  • Navigate prospect organizations to present our value proposition to influencers, stakeholders, and decision-makers
  • Collaborating with key decision makers to identify opportunities and develop ideas that deliver sales results
  • Following up with prospects several times throughout the sales cycle to ensure needs are being met
  • Preparing and presenting proposals and bids
  • Negotiating terms and conditions with prospects
  • Manage a pipeline of opportunities in Hubspot and communicate regularly on progress and status
  • Identify opportunities for prospects to act as public TuxCare advocates (e.g. testimonials, case studies)
  • Collaborate closely with company leadership to identify expansion opportunities
  • Work with SEs, CSM and Account Manager to ensure successful new customer adoption and onboarding
  • Staying current on company offerings and industry trends

Requirements

To be successful in this role you should have:

  • 5+ years in Business Development or Enterprise Sales
  • A successful track record showing a high close rate and expedited sales cycles
  • Knowledge of Linux infrastructure and/or security software
  • Exceptional communication skills, highly organized, collaborative and detail-oriented
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize appropriately across multiple concurrent engagements
  • Experience building and maintaining relationships, while working to mitigate risk and drive successful deal closure
  • Experience working with Hubspot is a plus

Benefits

What's in it for you?

  • A focus on professional development;
    • Training reimbursements
    • Mentor programs
    • Knowledge-Exchange programs
    • Interesting and challenging projects
  • Flexible working hours
  • Paid 24 days of vacation per year and unlimited sick leave
  • Medical insurance reimbursement
  • Co-working and gym/sports reimbursement
  • The opportunity to receive a reward for the most innovative idea that the company can patent.

By applying for this position, you agree with Cloudlinux Privacy Policy and give us your consent to maintain and process your personal data with this respect. Please read our Privacy Policy for more information.

results.title: Strategic Account Manager
results.description:
FormAssembly is growing fast and we are excited to add a Strategic Account Manager to focus on our top strategic customers in select sectors. You will be working on expansion business within territory based on Named Accounts. This is a full-time position, open to all locations (working remotely from home)

Responsibilities:

  • Selling FormAssembly licenses, support and services across a predominantly existing strategic customer list.
  • Increasing revenue spend within a list of strategic global companies
  • Having a deep understanding of the way businesses operate, how private and public companies make decisions, and the priorities that drive decisions from the C-level.
  • Building account strategy and territory plans
  • Building credibility and trust while influencing buying decisions.
  • Uncovering executive-level initiatives and pain points to map back our solutions across multiple lines of business.
  • Selling on value.
  • Partnering with internal resources in order to drive additional value and expertise.
  • Generating pipeline that leads to closed revenue and quota attainment.
  • Accurately forecasting.

Requirements

  • 3+ years of YoY account growth, 5+ years of full cycle sales experience
  • Experience managing a maximum of 20-30 accounts, majority existing customers
  • Consistent annual quota attainment of at least $500,000 in ARR
  • Experience selling to the C-suite (all LOB)
  • Experience in comprehending and delivering compelling value propositions.
  • Ability to manage extended teams consisting of solution engineers, customer success, implementation services, sales development resources.

Bonus Points for:

  • Experience working remote
  • Bachelor's degree



Benefits

FormAssembly offers several benefits that help to facilitate a healthy team, personal growth, and a work-life balance, all of which contribute to creating a more engaged and passionate workforce.

  • Health benefits (health, dental, vision) for team members based in the United States
  • 401(k) with 4% company match for team members based in the United States
  • Unlimited paid vacation and 9 company holidays
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Paid parental leave
  • Charitable contribution match
  • Budget for professional development
  • Company provided Mac laptop

You'll be joining a talented and fun team, working together to build something great!

results.title: Sales Development Representative
results.description:
FormAssembly is growing, we're not slowing down, and we're aiming high in 2023! We are looking for experienced and previously successful SDRs to join our team and make an immediate impact on the pipeline. The most successful candidates for this role are proactive and continuous learners who want to level up their skill set, add value to an amazing company and SDR team, and have aspirations for a long-term sales career.

As a Sales Development Representative with FormAssembly, you will be provided with some inbound leads, however, there will be a focus on generating some of our own pipeline with a strategic and thoughtful outbound motion. Our primary goal is to schedule high-quality meetings for our Account Executive team to close and drive revenue for the growing organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Schedule qualified meetings for our Account Executive team, from marketing-generated, inbound leads, as well as from strategic and outbound prospecting efforts.
  • Prospect and develop leads with phone calls, email cadences, LinkedIn outreach, and other resourceful “smart selling” lead generation practices.
  • Perform pre-call prospect research on leads and contacts.
  • Learn prospects’ current challenges and desired future state to offer a solution.
  • Proactively provide feedback to the manager and other teams with the goal of continuous improvement for all.
  • Actively collaborate cross-departmentally with a growth mindset and an eye on the big picture.
  • Maintain proper CRM data integrity and hygiene.

Requirements

  • 3-6+ months of previous SDR experience demonstrating success in the role.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Proactively focused on continuous and perpetual improvement in your craft.
  • Coachable and hungry to learn.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills.
  • Proficient in using and learning new technology and systems.
  • Preferably located in a U.S Eastern/Central time zone, or be able to work standard U.S. Eastern hours daily
 
Bonus Points
  • Sales Experience.
  • SaaS Experience.
  • Salesforce Experience.
  • Remote work Experience.

About Us:

FormAssembly is a 100% remote SaaS company dedicated to helping customers streamline organizational processes and be better stewards of their data and we are looking for key individuals to join our rapidly growing team.

Customers like Amazon, PayPal, New York City, Harvard, and thousands of other organizations worldwide rely on FormAssembly to capture the data they need quickly and securely. We have been recognized in the 2020 Inc. 5000 list of fastest-growing private companies, and we are a G2 Crowd Winter 2021 Leader.

We're intelligent, adaptive, and growing rapidly - thanks to our impressive roster of customers.

Here are some links to give you a peek into what it's like to work at FormAssembly:

Meet our awesome team.

Learn how and why we work remotely.

If you’re a genuinely nice person who is great to work with, respectful, and who will put the team and our customers first, we’d be thrilled to have you apply for this position. FormAssembly is an equal-opportunity employer. If you belong to an under-represented group in tech, you’ll find a welcoming culture that thrives on diversity.

This is a full-time position, open to all locations (working remotely from home)

Benefits

FormAssembly offers several benefits that help to facilitate a healthy team, personal growth, and a work-life balance, all of which contribute to creating a more engaged and passionate workforce.

  • Health benefits (health, dental, vision) for team members based in the United States
  • 401(k) with 4% company match for team members based in the United States
  • Unlimited/Flexible paid vacation and 9 company holidays
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Paid parental leave
  • Charitable contribution match
  • And more!

results.title: Sales Executive - Gaming SAAS
results.description:
We are Gfinity! An esports operator & technology company serving some of the largest brands on the planet - the Premier league, Formula1, Redbull, NVIDIA, Nintendo, and many more.  Over the past 10 years, we've pioneered the world's most powerful tournament platform able to serve hundreds of thousands of concurrent competitors across thousands of simultaneous events.  We are now using this foundational technology to create a fully self-serviced product for game studios and web publishers to leverage the power of competition to drive gamer retention, engagement, and value.

We are looking for a passionate gamer and sales expert, someone who is enthusiastic to drive our go to market plan, engage with gaming developers, research and create an action plan and have experience with generating new business.

You will play an active role in helping us craft the go-to-market strategy for the new product, owning the sales development process, and driving sales of the products into the game services market. You will work with game publishers, game developers and game services platforms involved in creating the technology infrastructure for games in the emerging space of Live Operations within the broader gaming eco-system. 

You ideally bring strong knowledge of the gaming infrastructure service and development cycle and both platform or SaaS sales processes. You probably have prior experience with an established SaaS company or a start-up, or game services/infrastructure companies, or a game development studio.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Market sizing, outreach, research and creation of the action plan
  • Owning and building a new sales development process for the Engage technology product
  • Facilitating & crafting with the teams the correct tools for sales and client engagement
  • Leading customer engagement & development for product demos and technology reviews for POC’s, Pilots or test cases 
  • Proactively looking into the competitor market and identify opportunity for growth and work with our Tech team in "developing" new features based on market knowledge and opportunity

Key Qualifications:

  • Good experience and exposure in the technology areas of game publishers/developers
  • Good understanding of the gaming space and great insight into the gaming publishing world, the concerns, issues they are experiencing so we can help solve for them
  • Ideally you have a strong understanding of technology, data and SaaS platforms and you have worked with development teams before
  • Understanding of monetization models, launch strategy and FTP in game industry
  • Comfortable working with sets of customer data that illustrates value
  • Strong analytical skills, data presentation skills, and creating customer presentations.
  • Experience working with and facilitating cross functional groups in operational processes.

We are striving to create a diverse and inclusive environment. We encourage all applicants to apply for our roles and not for a moment think that anything will make us discriminate against them. We value and actively seek diverse talent!

Location: Remotely based

results.title: Sales Account Executive (f/m/d)
results.description:
UK & Ireland Sales Account Executive (f/m/d)

Stratio is the World’s Leading Real-time Predictive Fleet Maintenance Platform. The company's proprietary technology combines large-scale processing with the latest machine learning techniques to prevent hundreds of thousands of breakdowns from happening every day, thus saving millions of people from the hassle of public transportation delays, postponed deliveries, or late arrival of essential goods. Stratio’s platform enables zero downtime for 5 of the 10 largest transportation companies in the world and, in 2021, raised an investment of $12 million to boost leadership in predictive fleet maintenance. Fleet operators in Europe, North America, Asia-pacific, and Latin America trust Stratio’s technology to fully leverage the data under the hood to safeguard operations, and keep customers happy. Stratio’s technology has enabled transportation for 1.3 billion people so far.



Your contribute to a #zerodowntimefuture

You’ll be joining our Sales team, which seeks to drive new customers to adopt our predictive maintenance solution and which is the commercial point of contact throughout their lifetime with us.

As Senior Sales Account Executive you will be responsible for generating incremental ARR in the UK and Ireland region, focused on the public transportation sector, waste management companies and truck distributors.

As Sales Account Executive you will
  • Work to meet, or exceed, the annual incremental ARR sales target;
  • Develop new customers/business for revenue growth;
  • Maintain and grow existing customer service/relationships;
  • Work with the Global Partner Manager to support and develop potential partners;
  • Collaborate with other sales for cross-sell and business expansion.

 

More specifically

  • Manage existing customer relationships in the territory with strategic and results-oriented efforts to avoid cancellations and accelerate growth in the accounts;
  • Develop and bring a robust pipeline of new business opportunities by extracting value from your personal network and through cooperation with marketing as well as with other members of the sales team;
  • Meet, or exceed, the set target for bringing incremental ARR to Stratio;
  • Work with the Global Partner Manager to manage the relationship with partners in the region.

 

We expect you to
  • Achieve the assigned iARR Sales Target;
  • Identify new of new opportunities within assigned accounts, and the identification of new potential customers;
  • Achieve Overall Territory Growth and Renewal Retention Rate Target. Take action to increase customer satisfaction, reduce cancellations, preserve and increase customer investment with Stratio;
  • Develop of Account Plans and customer profiles as well as Territory Plans and Sales Strategies;
  • Build long term solid relationships with the customer base;
  • To ensure the Company CRM system is accurate and up to date;
  • Deliver any requested reports on time, as well as accurate sales and renewal forecasts;
  • Attend any relevant events, trade shows or conferences, to discuss and demonstrate Stratio products;
  • Work closely with Marketing to drive campaigns in the region;
  • Coordinate with our Service team to deliver projects and develop customers.

 

This is what we believe is needed for this role
  • 5+ years of sales experience – preferably in the UK and Ireland region;
  • Understanding of consultative selling techniques - able to close deals and build relationships;
  • Ability to interact with and sell to senior-level management;
  • Ability to work as part of a team and autonomously, being able to be self-driven and self-directed;
  • Work in a virtual team with manager in a remote location;
  • Understanding of the legal environment of local markets, following directions from legal counsel on contract terms and conditions;
  • Comfortable working in a complex and fast-paced organization;
  • Availability to travel as necessary for the completion of work;
  • Full or native English proficiency;
  • Ability to independently use SaaS solutions and sell the benefits.


Bonus points

  • Excellent interpersonal and team playing skills;
  • Excellent presentation and communication skills.

 

What we offer
  • This job role has a compensation package structured in two components: base pay plus commission. Commission is earned by closing sales (meeting sales quota / target). The commission component is uncapped, meaning the sales executive will continue to earn commissions after the target (expected sales volume) is met;
  • Health Insurance;
  • Flexible Work Hours - adjust your schedule to your needs;
  • Remote Work Setup;
  • Monthly All-Hands;
  • Quarterly Events to discuss Strategy;
  • Autonomy and Ownership Culture;
  • Continuous feedback culture;
  • Innovation Mindset;
  • Career Acceleration.

 

Location
  • United Kingdom / Remote

 

What you can expect from our hiring process
  • Screening call with HR
  • 1st Interview (1h)
    HR and Hiring Manager
    We want to get to know you better and navigate through your experience, skills and motivation.
  • Technical Interview (1-2h)
    Hiring Manager
    Deep dive into your skills and assessment of your technical knowledge. 
  • Cultural Fit Interview (1h)
    HR Manager and one of our Founders
    Validate the cultural fit between you and Stratio and make sure you’re the person we’re looking for to help us build a #zerodowntimefuture.
  • Hiring Proposal

The process includes reference checking.

 

 

----

We want inspiring individuals in our teams, where age, race, gender, sexual orientation, politics and religion do not matter, and seek to create a tolerant and open space for everyone. We thrive to provide an inclusive and trustworthy environment.

You can find our Culture Manifesto and more team information here.

Take the road with us!
